item.title: 98% Economy on Data Lake
item.description: The beginning One day I was looking at some of the KPIs from our Data lake, we use a pretty “standard” stack with:

item.title: _Clang - trees
item.description: #clang #data-engineering #ComputerScience Types of Trees [[Binary Search Tree]] Each node has at most 2 children The left child is less than the parent The right child is greater than the parent No duplicates [[AVL Tree]] Self-balancing binary search tree The height of left and right subtrees of any node differ by at most 1 Insertion and deletion operations may cause the tree to become unbalanced [[Red-Black Tree]] Self-balancing binary search tree Each node is either red or black The root node is always black New nodes are always red No two adjacent red nodes Every path from a node to a null node has the same number of black nodes [[Balanced-Tree (B-tree)]] Self-balancing tree Each node can have more than 2 children Used in databases and file systems Each node contains a list of keys and a list of children Keys are sorted in ascending order Keys in the left child are less than the keys in the parent node Keys in the right child are greater than the keys in the parent node All leaves are at the same level [[B+ Tree]] Self-balancing tree Each node can have more than 2 children Used in databases and file systems Each node contains a list of keys and a list of children Keys are sorted in ascending order Keys in the left child are less than or equal to the keys in the parent node Keys in the right child are greater than the keys in the parent node All leaves are at the same level All keys are present in the leaf nodes Leaf nodes are linked together [[Splay Tree]] Self-balancing binary search tree Recently accessed nodes are moved closer to the root Used in caches and memory allocators

item.title: _Extract data from MongoDB using python
item.description: #data-engineering #python #pandas #mongodb The problem In the company, I’m currently working for, I was tasked to create a pipeline to bring data from MongoDB to our DataLake.

item.title: Learning SQL
item.description: #data #SQL What is SQL? Structured Query Language (SQL pronounced S Q L or Sequel) is a language focused in access and manipulating Databases, it became an ANSI standard in 1986 and ISO in 1987.

item.title: Python - Mutable and Immutable types
item.description: While programming in Python, have you ever found a variable that changed its value seemly out of the blue? Perhaps you found someone else’s code that passes a variable to a function but returns nothing, and still, the variable was changed outside that function?

item.title: SQL Tables
item.description: What are SQL Tables? All [[_RDBMS]] uses the same principle to store data: A two-dimensional table consisted of Data rows on the Horizontal Axis and strictly enforced column types on the Vertical Axis.
